body: @xvrl I think that's reasonable. Modified to enforce as a limit.

@nishantmonu51 they get uploaded to S3 on each restart, with new uploads overriding previous uploads. The FTR opens the log in "append" mode so each upload will contain logs from all previous runs of the same task.
@nishantmonu51 I do think that in the future we should make the uploading happen in chunks rather than all at once- but this would be a different PR
:+1:  These are generated by `mvn install`
@himanshug @nishantmonu51 @drcrallen pushed a new commit, the main change is in firehose-closing behavior. also looking at adding some tests.

hmm, I think there's a further problem. If you don't close the kafka firehose, and no new data is forthcoming, I believe it will block forever on hasMore. I don't think there's anything we can do about that right now, but that points to potentially wanting to have a timeout on hasMore or a poll-style Firehose interface.
What that means is that if you do try to stopGracefully a realtime task reading from a dry kafka firehose, it will likely time out and be killed after the gracefulShutdownTimeout (default 5 minutes)
@drcrallen addressed all the comments, URI building turned out not to be so simple when dealing with encoded parameters.
added some tests.
Hi @se7entyse7en, did you get a chance to look at @drcrallen's comments?
Hi @noddi, i have a few minor comments and I'm good to merge this after that.
@himanshug @nishantmonu51 @drcrallen @guobingkun pushed updates for outstanding comments + also some unit tests for restoring realtime tasks

Hello @fjy 
Thanks for code review.
Changes:
- license header
- removed "this"
- moved duplicated code to setProperties method
- extracted getDatasources method to new InventoryViewUtils class

`Running io.druid.query.extraction.namespace.TestKafkaExtractionCluster
Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 8.404 sec <<< FAILURE! - in io.druid.query.extraction.namespace.TestKafkaExtractionCluster`
cool :+1:
test `DruidCoordinatorTest.testCoordinatorRun:349 expected:<1> but was:<0>` failed, does not seem related to this PR, bouncing.

This looks great @navis, thanks for the contribution!

Could you also please include docs for this change, and fill out our CLA? For the docs, I believe filters.md and searchqueryspec.md should be updated. The CLA is at: http://druid.io/community/cla.html

Oh man, this looks awesome. I can not wait to add this to Plywood and https://github.com/implydata/druid.d.ts only thing is could you please update the docs? I need the docs because I reference them from comments in https://github.com/implydata/druid.d.ts/blob/master/druid/druid.d.ts
Closing/Reopening for travis

This is looking good overall. @navis can you also please make sure to apply the druid style mentioned in https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-to-contribute

There are also a few files missing the copyright notice at the top.

@gianm @drcrallen how about we make search case-sensitive by default?
Everything else in druid is, and we're bumping up to 0.9.x anyways. Thoughts?
@xvrl perhaps, although if so I think we should do it in a separate PR as that is a different discussion from adding a feature.
@noddi Thanks for the contrib! Can you sign the CLA here: http://druid.io/community/cla.html and we'll get this merged in
I'm sorry I've just noticed your comments, I'm gonna work on this as soon as I can. @drcrallen how do I have to squash the commits?
@fjy could you summarize the things that you are wanting to remove?

@fjy I suspect if this is going to have merge conflicts with https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1804 which is ready to be merged. 
@xvrl @drcrallen  can you pls check #1804 and merge if it is ok?
agree with @himanshug, we should wait for 1804 so he doesn't have to redo all the work
Is anyone else available to review this? Would like to do a PR for #1515 but it depends on this.

Hi, I rebased the branch and added the entry as @guobingkun said and everything seems to work fine!
Here's what I've done to make it run:

```
mvn clean install -DskipTests=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true
tar -xzvf distribution/target/druid-0.9.0-SNAPSHOT-bin.tar.gz -C /usr/local
tar -xzvf distribution/target/mysql-metdata-storage-bin.tar.gz -C /usr/local/druid-0.9.0-SNAPSHOT/druid_extensions/
./run_druid_server.sh coordinator
./run_druid_server.sh historical
./run_druid_server.sh broker
JAVA_ARGS=-Ddruid.realtime.specFile=config/realtime/kafka_realtime.spec ./run_druid_server.sh realtime
```

Anyway I still had to add this `DRUID_CP="${DRUID_CP}:${SCRIPT_DIR}/druid_extensions/druid-cloudfiles-extensions/*"` in `run_druid_server.sh` to make it work. As far as I can see jclouds wants the providers (`rackspace-cloudfiles-uk-1.9.1.jar`, `rackspace-cloudfiles-us-1.9.1.jar`) to be present in the classpath. Except for this thing it works like a charm and it also seem to start more faster than before.

Regarding the additional classpath, may it be an issue for the acceptance of this merge? Do you think that it could be useful to check if `DRUID_CP` is already defined in `run_druid_server.sh`? So that is it possible to write something like:

```
JAVA_ARGS=-Ddruid.realtime.specFile=config/realtime/kafka_realtime.spec DRUID_CP=druid_extensions/druid-cloudfiles-extensions/* ./run_druid_server.sh realtime
```

Hi @se7entyse7en,  thanks for trying it out :) There are no issues here, the script in the tarball doesn't load your extension by default, if users want to use your extension, they can edit `druid.extensions.loadList` or add it to the classpath. So in your case, another way to let Druid load your extension is to add `"druid-cloudfiles-extensions"` in `druid.extensions.loadList`(you can modify the value of that property in common.runtime.properties under `druid-0.9.0-SNAPSHOT/config/_common`), then at runtime, Druid will look for `druid-cloudfiles-extensions` under extensions directory.

:+1: given that,
- Single segment announcing provided a transition for folks upgrading from 0.6.x, and we've kept it for a couple major versions but should not keep it forever
- Bridge nodes / Offheap ingestion / IndexMaker are not documented and I believe nobody uses them

Also agree we should hold for #1804.
I agree that ideally search should be case sensitive by default. Did not suggest it because did not want to break backwards compatibility.
:+1: looks good to me
this PR looks good to me after figuring out what we want to do with `druid.processing.bitmap.type` - either remove it from the docs, or add support back in but mark it deprecated in the docs.

@gian support for `druid.processing.bitmap.type` becomes complicated inside IndexSpec no arg constructor once we lose static properties object inside IndexIO  also it needs hacks to support it inside hadoop indexing as well . Code said it was deprecated (dint look at the doc at the time) and hence removed it to keep things simple. Since this is going inside a new major release, I believe it is OK.
@himanshug ok sounds fair
:+1: looks good to me
failed on `BrokerServerViewTest.testSingleServerAddedRemovedSegment:113->setupZNodeForServer:384  NodeExists`
@se7entyse7en for squashing, please see https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#github-workflow number 7

Thanks for the contrib! Do you mind signing http://druid.io/community/cla.html?

WIll merge after that

@guobingkun to make it work I both added the extension in the classpath and `"druid-cloudfiles-extensions"` in `druid.extensions.loadList`. Initially I only modified the `loadList` setting, but it was not working.

Signed. Thanks for your help too!
:+1: looks good to me after [squash](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#github-workflow) / CLA

@se7entyse7en hmm..that's weird, I tried your patch and did the same steps as you did and it worked fine. Could you share me the log that indicates that it doesn't work?

Let me show you what I did,

**1.** Go to Druid working directory, then 
`mvn clean install -DskipTests=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true`

**2.**`tar -xzvf distribution/target/druid-0.9.0-SNAPSHOT-bin.tar.gz -C /usr/local`

**3.**`tar -xzvf distribution/target/mysql-metdata-storage-bin.tar.gz -C /usr/local/druid-0.9.0-
SNAPSHOT/druid_extensions/`

**4.** Go to `/usr/local/druid-0.9.0-SNAPSHOT`, now if you do `ls druid_extensions`, 
you should see

```
druid-azure-extensions          druid-examples              druid-kafka-eight           druid-namespace-lookup          mysql-metdata-storage
druid-cassandra-storage         druid-hdfs-storage          druid-kafka-eight-simple-consumer   druid-rabbitmq              postgresql-metadata-storage
druid-cloudfiles-extensions     druid-histogram             druid-kafka-extraction-namespace    druid-s3-extensions
```

, which contains your extension `druid-cloudfiles-extensions`.

**5.**  `vi config/_common/common.runtime.properties` and edit `druid.extensions.loadList`
so that you have `druid.extensions.loadList=["druid-examples","druid-kafka-eight", "druid-cloudfiles-extensions"]` 

**6.** `./run_druid_server.sh coordinator`
From the log, you should see this line to verify `loadList` contains `druid-cloudfiles-extensions`,

```
2015-11-02T16:14:36,050 INFO [main] io.druid.guice.JsonConfigurator - Loaded class[class io.druid.guice.ExtensionsConfig] from props[druid.extensions.] as [ExtensionsConfig{searchCurrentClassloader=true, directory='druid_extensions', hadoopDependenciesDir='hadoop_druid_dependencies', loadList=[druid-examples, druid-kafka-eight, druid-cloudfiles-extensions]}]
```

You should also see this log to verify that `druid-cloudfiles-extensions` is loaded,

```
2015-11-02T16:14:36,193 INFO [main] io.druid.initialization.Initialization - Loading extension [druid-cloudfiles-extensions] for class [io.druid.initialization.DruidModule]
2015-11-02T16:14:36,194 INFO [main] io.druid.initialization.Initialization - Adding local file system extension module [io.druid.storage.cloudfiles.CloudFilesStorageDruidModule] for class [io.druid.initialization.DruidModule]
```

@se7entyse7en Thanks, I reproduced the problem, let me investigate.

seems strangely long, but, if the larger timeouts help on slow VMs then that sounds cool to me.

:+1:
These are indeed slow VMs where the query times are very long, and it would useful to increase the timeouts - but, in any case I am going to do some investigation to see why they are taking so long.
thanks @itsmee!

@himanshug I had marked default bitmap config deprecated mainly because it is possible to specify it in the index spec ever since we added compression, whereas before that property was the only way to specify it. It might still be nice to be able to specify a default, but I'm also not wedded to it if you think it's too cumbersome to maintain. A more general way to specify indexing default might be nice in the future though.
other than my concerns about jackson injection, the rest looks fine to me.
bouncing for unrelated test failure.
Why rename?
@drcrallen see https://github.com/druid-io/docker-druid/pull/14#discussion_r43662742
Sent corporate CLA just now. Thanks.
@navis Received, thanks!
@navis if you are unable to use the intellij formatting stuff in my prior link please let me know and I'll do it on my side.

I found that the virtual machine where the queries were taking an extremely long time had gotten into a strange state.  I rebooted the machine and restarted druid, and things improved greatly.   Larger timeouts are still needed, because of virtual machine slowness and unpredictable timing in test environments that are using hadoop storage, but I don't think there's any problem with how druid handles these queries.  Thanks for doing the merge.
@drcrallen I think I've applied the formatting to all of the codes affected. Any missing part? I'm good on your doing it for me. Thanks.

Pull request for the same:
https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1904

say a task T allocates a new segment and hands it off, then it receives another event in the same interval. This time, task is supposed to use the "previousId" so that a new segment gets allocated. For this, is task supposed to retain a list of all the segments it has handed off in its lifetime? What happens if/when task is restored (do we keep that list maintained on disk as well) ?
changes looks good, :+1:
@himanshug it needs to remember the last segment that has been allocated in its sequence (last overall, not last per interval, so just one segment).
